section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Fees) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: hourly rate (每小時收費率) means the rate per hour calculated in accordance with regulation 7; (L.N. 352 of 1983)
surveyor (驗船師) means a Government surveyor;
tons (噸) means gross tons, and in the case of a ship having alternative gross tonnages, the larger of those gross tonnages. (L.N. 139 of 1970)

subsection.content: Subject to regulation 5, the fees prescribed in the Schedule shall be payable in respect of the matters specified in relation thereto in that Schedule. (L.N. 247 of 1992; L.N. 252 of 1994)

Except where otherwise specified in the Schedule or by necessary implication, the fees prescribed for the issue of any certificate shall be in respect of a certificate valid for a period of 12 months.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Fees for service within Hong Kong
section.content: Where the issue of any certificate or clearance is dependent upon the carrying out of any survey or inspection within Hong Kong during office hours any fee prescribed by these regulations shall include the services of a surveyor together with any travelling or other expenses involved.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Fees for services outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: Where the issue of any certificate or clearance is dependent upon any survey or inspection to be undertaken outside Hong Kong by a surveyor sent from Hong Kong for that purpose, there shall be payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fee calculated in accordance with subregulation (3); and (43 of 1999 s. 91)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the travelling and subsistence expenses of the surveyor in such reasonable sum as the Director shall determine.

subsection.leadIn: For any survey or inspection described in Sections A, B, C, D, E, G, H, I, J, K, L and O in Part II of the Schedule, the fee payable shall be— (44 of 1995 s. 143)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the fee for the services is entirely determinable by the time involved, the sum of $7,645, in lieu of an hourly rate, for each period of 24 hours or part thereof during which the surveyor is absent from Hong Kong on account of the survey or inspection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the fee for the services is not determinable by the time involved, the sum of $15,290 for the whole period during which the surveyor is absent from Hong Kong on account of the survey or inspection, and in addition, the fee specified in the relevant Sections of the Schedule; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the fee for the services is partly determinable and partly not determinable by the time involved, the aggregate of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the services determinable by the time involved, the sum of $7,645 for each period of 24 hours or part thereof during which the surveyor is absent from Hong Kong, less the actual number of hours the surveyor is required to undertake that particular survey or inspection referred to in subparagraph (ii); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the services not determinable by the time involved, the fee for the services specified in the relevant Sections of the Schedule. (L.N. 334 of 1994; L.N. 270 of 1995)

subsection.content: The duration of a surveyor’s absence from Hong Kong shall be calculated with reference to the departure time and arrival time from and at Hong Kong.

Where part of the survey or inspection undertaken by a surveyor is done within Hong Kong and part of it is done outside Hong Kong, the fee payable for each part shall be calculated according to regulation 3 and this regulation respectively.

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Fees for sending documents by telegram, telex or post
section.content: Where in connection with any service specified in Part II of the Schedule or the issue of a certificate specified in Part II of the Schedule it is, in the opinion of the Director, necessary to incur expense to transmit information, plans, calculations or other documents to places outside Hong Kong by telegram, telex or post there shall be payable in addition to the fee specified in Part II of the Schedule the expense involved.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Fees for services outside office hours
section.leadIn: Except in the case of a service rendered by the Mercantile Marine Office or the Registry of Shipping or Port Control Section, where the issue of any certificate or clearance is dependent upon any survey or inspection or where any other service is required to be undertaken outside office hours, there is payable, in addition to the appropriate fee specified in these regulations and the Schedule, if any, a fee based upon the following scale— (L.N. 175 of 2024)

td.p: between the hours of 7 a.m. and 8:30 a.m.
or
5:45 p.m. and 7 p.m.
$1,115 per hour or part hour;
before 7 a.m.
or
after 7 p.m.
$2,215 per hour or part hour;

td.p: On Saturdays, Sundays or Public Holidays

section.proviso: Provided that if 3 days’ notice of the requirement for any survey, or inspection or other service has been given to the Director but notwithstanding such notice the Director has caused the survey, or inspection or other service to be undertaken outside office hours, no such additional fee is payable.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Fees for miscellaneous services
section.leadIn: Where for any service other than a service for which a fee is specified in the Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where an officer of the Marine Department is required to visit a vessel, shore installation navigational aid or other site, the fee payable for each such visit during office hours shall be $3,270 for the first hour or part hour and $1,115 for each subsequent hour or part hour during which the visit continues; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fee payable for such service in any other case during office hours shall be $1,115 for each hour or part hour during which the service continues.

section.name: s7A
section.heading: Fees where service is not completed
section.content: Where, on the application of the owner or agent of a vessel, work on any service in respect of that vessel is undertaken by any officer of the Marine Department and, in consequence of any act of the owner or his agent, such work is abandoned before the completion thereof, there shall be payable such reasonable sum as the Director may agree with the applicant, having regard to the nature and extent of the work involved.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Fees for issue of certificates of survey, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where for any purpose any officer of the Marine Department is required to issue any certificate of survey, permit, approval, or document of authority, consequent upon or pertaining to the carrying out of any service specified in Part II of the Schedule, there shall be payable a fee of $565, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issue is specified in that Part to be included in the service in question;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a fee for the issue is specified in that Part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the issue is that of a certificate for a ship in respect of which a service relevant to the issue of the certificate has been rendered by an organization approved under section 8(1) of the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 369).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of subregulation (3), where for any purpose any officer of the Marine Department is required to issue any copy of, or to make any alteration in, any certificate of survey, permit, approval, or document of authority, in respect of which the original thereof was issued consequent upon or pertaining to the carrying out of any service specified in Part II of the Schedule, whether such copy is required to be issued or such alteration made at the time of the issue of the original or not, there shall be payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fee of $565 for each copy or alteration where no fee for the issue of the original is specified in Part II of the Schedule or the issue of the original is declared in that Part to be included in the service; and (L.N. 247 of 1992; L.N. 333 of 1993; L.N. 334 of 1994; L.N. 270 of 1995)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a fee equal to the amount of the fee specified in Part II of the Schedule in any case in which a fee is specified therein for the issue of the original.

subsection.content: No fee shall be payable for the issue of the duplicate of any certificate of survey, permit, approval, or document of authority, in any case in which it is declared in Part II of the Schedule that such certificate, permit, approval, or document of authority, shall be issued in duplicate.

Where for any purpose any officer of the Marine Department is required to issue any copy of, or make any alteration in, any licence, permit, certificate, or document of authority, issued in respect of or pertaining to any service specified in the Schedule, other than in Part II thereof, no fee shall be payable for the issue of such copy, or the making of such alteration, unless a fee therefor is so specified in which case such fee shall be payable.

Where the Director consents at the request of an applicant to supply a copy of, or to make any alteration to, any licence, permit, certificate, document or plan referred to in these regulations, there shall be payable, in addition to the fees prescribed for such services therein, a handling charge of such reasonable sum in respect of such service as the Director may agree with the applicant therefor, having regard to the nature and extent of the work involved. (L.N. 352 of 1983)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Fees for attendance at legal proceedings or inquiries
section.leadIn: Where an officer of the Marine Department is required to attend any legal proceedings or inquiry in his capacity as a Government official there shall be payable in respect thereof—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the attendance is in Hong Kong during office hours, a fee of $1,115 for each hour or part hour of attendance; and (L.N. 247 of 1992; L.N. 333 of 1993; L.N. 334 of 1994; L.N. 270 of 1995)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the attendance is outside Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a fee of $7,645 for each period or part period of 24 hours during which the officer is absent from Hong Kong on account of the attendance; and (L.N. 333 of 1993; L.N. 334 of 1994; L.N. 270 of 1995)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the travelling and subsistence expenses of the officer in such reasonable sums as the Director shall determine. (L.N. 247 of 1992)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Charges for advice and examination of plans
section.text: Where the Director consents to survey, tender advice or examine plans in respect of the structure, machinery or equipment of a vessel in so far as such structure, machinery or equipment is to comply with statutory requirements or with any other requirements and no fee for such survey, advice or examination is prescribed, there shall be payable such reasonable sum in respect of such survey, advice or examination as the Director may agree with the applicant therefor, having regard to the nature and extent of the work involved.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Fees payable in advance
section.leadIn: Every fee shall be paid at the Marine Department in advance of the service in respect of which such fee is payable:
section.proviso: Provided that the Director may in his discretion in any particular case permit any fee to be paid, in whole or in part, in arrear, and subject to such conditions as to security or time for payment as he may think fit.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Services required for certain official purposes

subsection.content: No fee or charge shall be payable in respect of any copy of any certificate referred to in these regulations which is supplied at the request of a department of the Central People’s Government, or the representative of a government other than the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region when the copy of a certificate is required for official purposes.

No fee specified in the Schedule shall be payable in respect of any service referred to in these regulations which is performed at the request of any department of the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, any public body or the representative of any government other than the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, but the Director may make such charge in respect of the service rendered as he may consider appropriate.
